docs.snippet: Pope Francis on Saturday inducted new Roman Catholic cardinals to the group that will choose his successor, telling them their high rank was a call to be humble and work for justice.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis on Saturday inducted new Roman Catholic cardinals to the group that will choose his successor, telling them their high rank was a call to be humble and work for justice.

headline.main: Be Humble and Work for Justice, Pope Tells New Cardinals

docs.snippet: Pope Francis elevated 20 Roman Catholic bishops and archbishops to the rank of cardinal at a ceremony in St. Peter's Basilica on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis elevated 20 Roman Catholic bishops and archbishops to the rank of cardinal at a ceremony in St. Peter's Basilica on Saturday.

docs.snippet: Top government officials rallied behind Argentina's President Cristina Fernandez on Saturday after a state prosecutor said he would keep investigating accusations that she tried to cover up Iran's alleged involvement in a 1994 bombing.

headline.main: Top Officials Close Rank Around Argentina's Embattled President
headline.print_headline: Top Officials Close Rank Around Argentina's Embattled President

docs.snippet: Qualifier Luca Vanni of Italy defeated home-crowd favorite Joao Souza 6-4, 6-7 (5), 6-4 at the Brazil Open on Saturday, reaching his first ATP final.

docs.snippet: Last year was a banner year for falsehoods from presidents, prime ministers and pundits.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last year was a banner year for falsehoods from presidents, prime ministers and pundits.
docs.abstract: Op-Chart by Bill Adair and Maxime Fischer-Zernin rounds up some of the worst lies told in 2014 by politicians across the world, including claims made about Ebola, the Affordable Care Act and European Union.

headline.main: The Lies Heard Round the World
headline.print_headline: The Lies Heard Round the World

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

byline.original: By BILL ADAIR and MAXIME FISCHER-ZERNIN

docs.snippet: Atletico Madrid's hopes of a second straight La Liga crown were hanging by a thread on Sunday after a 2-0 loss at Celta Vigo that defender Diego Godin blamed on the absence of midfielders Koke, Arda Turan and Raul Garcia.

docs.snippet: Controversy is flaring over the six Guantanamo detainees taken in by Uruguay for resettlement, with even the man who pushed through the plan, President Jose Mujica, seeming to criticize them for lacking a work ethic.

docs.snippet: Just two months ago, Uruguay welcomed six Guantanamo detainees for resettlement as a humanitarian gesture, and relations have already gotten a little testy.

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez's stunning goal last weekend was outshone by the exploits of hat-trick man Lionel Messi but the bicycle kick strike could be just what the Uruguay forward needed after a stuttering start in Spain.
